page.title: 20EDUCATION/WORK IN CLANFIELD
page.content:
Schooling began in Clanfield in 1880.The present middle school was built in the 1920's and was extended in 1971 and again in 1978.There are 279 pupils, boys and girls between the ages of 8 and 12 years receiving a primary education.When they leave school there is little employment in the area as agriculture is no longer labour intensive. They must move away from home or find work in the nearby towns of Portsmouth,Havant or Petersfield. Oil has been found nearby and it remains to be seen what effect this will have in the future.
Information compiled by :_ Mrs Lucy Mitchell_Christie, Mrs Marie West and Mrs Thelma Humberston For North Emsworth Women's Institute.
